elements.title: Nargess Eskandari-Grünberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nargess Eskandari-Grünberg (pictured), the new mayor of Frankfurt, gave birth to her first child while a political prisoner in the wake of the Iranian Revolution?

elements.title: Cranksgiving (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cranksgiving has been described as "part bike ride, part food drive, part scavenger hunt"?

elements.title: Fateme Asadi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the body of Fateme Asadi was found 37 years after she was tortured and killed by the Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan when she attempted to ransom her husband?

elements.title: penetration enhancers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that penetration enhancers can open tight junctions to allow entry of drugs?

elements.title: James Diossa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James Diossa rescued the only public library and post office in Central Falls, Rhode Island, when the city went into bankruptcy?

elements.title: first judgement of 2022 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first judgement of 2022 from the High Court of Australia was considered a loss for a labour hire organisation, but a win for labour hire organisations?

elements.title: Eleanor Hadley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eleanor Hadley, a 29-year-old doctoral candidate in economics, was recruited by the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers to implement antitrust policies in occupied Japan?

elements.title: this article (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some believe that reading this article may cause a superintelligence from the future to torture you for eternity?
